name: understudy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an actor who learns the parts of other actors in a play, so that he or she can replace them if necessary, for example if they are ill: An understudy took over for the rest of the performance and the evening show. Understudies never know when they might have to go on. Compare
standby
stand-in
substitute noun
More examplesFewer examplesThe play starts with the Director announcing that one actor has been replaced by an understudy.Sometimes the understudy really does get a big break.She tells me she is indisposed, and her understudy is to play the part tonight.
